Wanayama gained possession 13 times, six more than any other player managed.

Wanyama overshadows Xhaka

Spurs and Arsenal moved to add power and stability to their midfield in the summer with the signings of Victor Wanyama and Granit Xhaka respectively.

There is no question who got the better deal.

Wanyama, an £11m buy from Southampton, stamped his presence all over midfield here with his imposing frame and ball-winning ability.

Xhaka, in contrast, was little more than a liability with his poor challenges and wayward distribution, again looking well short of the quality expected from a player bought for in the region of £30m.

It was a midfield battle that was this match in microcosm. Spurs were simply too good for Arsenal.

Wanayama gained possession 13 times, six more than any other player managed.

Wanyama overshadows Xhaka

Spurs and Arsenal moved to add power and stability to their midfield in the summer with the signings of Victor Wanyama and Granit Xhaka respectively.

There is no question who got the better deal.

Wanyama, an £11m buy from Southampton, stamped his presence all over midfield here with his imposing frame and ball-winning ability.

Xhaka, in contrast, was little more than a liability with his poor challenges and wayward distribution, again looking well short of the quality expected from a player bought for in the region of £30m.

It was a midfield battle that was this match in microcosm. Spurs were simply too good for Arsenal.

Arsenal Fan TV presenter Robbie claims he was racially abused by Tottenham supporters after needing police escort

The presenter of Arsenal Fan TV claims he was racially abused by trolls as he left White Hart Lane following the North London derby.

Arsenal's hopes of finishing in the top four took another blow as they went down 2-0 to local rivals Tottenham.

Robbie Lyle, the founder and presenter of the hit YouTube channel, was spotted by Spurs fans as he tried to make his way out of the ground.

An amateur video was shared on social media of Robbie being surrounded by police, as he struggled to get away from the stadium.

On top of the expletive-filled song, "You're f****** s***", Tottenham fans sung, "Robbie, what's the score?"

Wanayama gained possession 13 times, six more than any other player managed.

Wanyama overshadows Xhaka

Spurs and Arsenal moved to add power and stability to their midfield in the summer with the signings of Victor Wanyama and Granit Xhaka respectively.

There is no question who got the better deal.

Wanyama, an £11m buy from Southampton, stamped his presence all over midfield here with his imposing frame and ball-winning ability.

Xhaka, in contrast, was little more than a liability with his poor challenges and wayward distribution, again looking well short of the quality expected from a player bought for in the region of £30m.

It was a midfield battle that was this match in microcosm. Spurs were simply too good for Arsenal.

Tottenham have more quality than Arsenal, admits 'angry' Cech


A 2-0 defeat at White Hart Lane left the Gunners with a mountain to climb to qualify for next season's Champions League

An angry Petr Cech admits Tottenham have shown more quality and confidence than Arsenal this season after their crucial derby victory on Sunday.

Arsenal suffered a 2-0 loss to their north London rivals at White Hart Lane, second-half goals from Dele Alli and Harry Kane proving decisive.

The result leaves the Gunners six points adrift of the top four and a massive 17 behind second-placed Spurs, with Cech hugely frustrated after his fine individual display – one that saw him make nine saves – went unrewarded.

"I feel angry and disappointed because obviously this is not a game we wanted to lose," Cech told reporters after the match.

"This is a very big disappointment for us. With all the emotions, I have to say that we met a team that was full of confidence, well organised and they are having their best season. I think that showed, that little bit of more confidence and quality on their side.

"It hurts because it was a huge game for both teams. They needed to win to keep their title chances alive.

Following the 2-0 loss to Spurs, Mesut Ozil kicked a door in the tunnel out of frustration due to being picked for a dope test. (Mirror)

Ozil refused to comply with the test once selected, but when threatened with a fine he reacted by leaving his stud marks in the door.

It's believed the 28-year-old was arguing about the number of times he's been targeted for a 'random' post-match doping test this season.

Emmanuel Adebayor has lifted the lid on how he came to join Arsenal, stating that just one phone call got the deal done in two days.

Adebayor: "I was playing football with friends, one of them ran over with a phone & told me it was Wenger, I thought he was playing a joke."

Adebayor: "He told me he wanted me at Arsenal, I told him, ‘If you want me I'll jump on the first flight to London & sign the dotted line’."
